title: What are the new smartphones that are going to be launched? - Quora

response.answer_text: A number of new and upcoming mobile phones in India have been announced recently, making the list of best upcoming phones coming soon to India, quite interesting. And while the best smartphones available in India are still one of the best you can buy, the grass is always greener on the other side. These latest upcoming smartphones offer the newest innovations in mobile technology. So here’s our list of the best upcoming phones in India. These upcoming mobile phones range from flagship devices to budget offerings and thus every kind of buyer would have something to wait for. More importantly these upcoming smartphones in India will also feature the latest mobile hardware and software, which would make your investment that much better. So without further ado, here are the best upcoming smartphones in India. 1. GOOGLE PIXEL 4A  Screen Size 5.81" (1080x2340)Camera 12 | 8 MPRAM 6 GBBattery 3080 mAhFull specs Nearly everything about the Pixel 4a has leaked. The phone will reportedly be powered by the Snapdragon 730 SoC coupled with 6GB RAM and 128GB UFS 2.1 storage. It will stick to a single camera setup at the back while on the front, the Pixel 4a is expected to sport a punch-hole selfie camera. The launch date of the phone is as of yet unconfirmed but it’s likely to happen by April in China, following which it’s expected to land up in India. It’s also expected to launch soon in India and comes with the old promise of everything you need, and nothing you don’t from Poco. The Poco F2 Pro is basically a full-fledged flagship with the Snapdragon 865, a large 6.67-inch AMOLED display, LPDDR5 RAM and UFS 3.0 storage. The camera setup at the back, however, is similar to the Poco X2 that launched in India. It has the same 64MP primary camera, along with the ultrawide, tele-macro lens and a depth sensor. The phone also rocks a large 4700mAh battery with 30W fast charging support. LG WING  Screen Size NACamera NARAM NABattery NAFull specs The LG Wing, as has been leaked out in a hands-on video, comes with two displays that can be positioned perpendicular to each other. So you can have a primary display with your game running, while the second display can be flipped open to quickly reply to a message. There could be more use cases as well, and is part of a new trend in industrial design and smartphone form factor. The smartphone is rumoured to be powered by the Snapdragon 765 and rock a regular 6.8-inch primary OLED display and another 1:1 display, smaller in size. The smartphone is due to launch globally on September 14. It's not confirmed whether it will come to India. As for the cameras, there’s a 48MP primary sensor, an 8MP ultrawide, a 2MP macro and a 2MP depth sensor. The phone also packs a large 5020mAh battery with support for 18W fast charging and a 6.53-inch LCD display.
